sentences.english: Since then 16 years, the war stretches continuously, but are relatively small.
sentences.chinese: 此后的16年中，战争延绵不断，但规模都比较小。

sentences.english: Yet knowing how way leads on to way.
sentences.chinese: 但我知道路径延绵没有尽头。

sentences.english: The one builds the stage, is a sea of books dated back to the remote antiquity.
sentences.chinese: 筑起舞台的，是一座延绵在今与昔的浩瀚书海。

sentences.english: Fruit is the symbol for prosperity in the ancient family, which has the meaning of constant wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 果实在古代是祝颂家族兴旺，延绵不断的意思。

sentences.english: The landscape is flat, or at most gently rolling.
sentences.chinese: 这里风景单调，大多都是延绵起伏的缓坡。

sentences.english: Yet knowing how way leads to way.
sentences.chinese: 但我知道路径延绵无尽头。

sentences.english: The low, brownish-ocher mountains continued for hundreds of miles.
sentences.chinese: 褐赭色的山冈延绵数百英里不断。

sentences.english: The process of the rise of Western countries in modern times was accompanied by continuous war.
sentences.chinese: 近代西方国家的崛起进程伴随着延绵不断的战争。

sentences.english: Far away are the mountains of central Scotland, often covered with snow.
sentences.chinese: 极目远眺可见苏格兰中部常年冰雪覆盖的延绵群山。

sentences.english: The cornfields stretched southward as far as the eye could see.
sentences.chinese: 麦田向南不断延绵直至人眼的穷尽。

sentences.english: Around the temple, there are a lot of mountains and water.
sentences.chinese: 寺庙周围，山环水复，更有远山近岭，延绵开去。

sentences.english: The long and winding history of art brought along numerous - isms .
sentences.chinese: 艺术史的延绵更替造就了太多汗牛充栋的主义。

sentences.english: The great wall comprises of sets of wall located along the north part of China.
sentences.chinese: 长城位于中国的北方，延绵万里。

sentences.english: Love can touch us one time and last for a lifetime. And never let go till we're gone.
sentences.chinese: 一次爱的感动，延绵一生，永不言弃，直至地老天荒。

definition: continuous (esp. of mountain ranges)/to stretch long and unbroken/a continuous link/sostenuto (sustained, in music)
continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)
to stretch in an unbroken chain (esp. of mountains)
as far as the eye can see (idiom)
to stretch as far as the eye can see (idiom)
